pageContext.claim: “That [phrase -- looting leads to shooting] wasn't from some mayor in Miami, there was a man named Frank Rizzo from New Jersey, was a rough guy. He ran a rough operation, but he didn't have a lot of looting, I can tell you.”
pageContext.analysis: This is wrong. The "looting and shooting" phrase was infamously used by Miami police chief Walter Headley in a 1967 speech about combating "young hoodlums who have taken advantage of the civil rights campaign." Headley said his department had been successful "because I've let the word filter down that when the looting starts, the shooting starts." He added: "We don't mind being accused of police brutality."
